intro: Gendarussa tranquebariensis, commonly known as the Indian gendarussa, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern India. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters, with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in sandy soils near the coast. The flowers are often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory and antiseptic properties.
